application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The pine is a large, mature tree representing a prominent landscape feature which is visible from the dwellings in Frithwood Avenue. The tree has a high amenity value and makes a positive contribution to the visual and arboreal character of the local area.
No further evidence has been supplied from the previous application to fell this Pine (Ref. 6498/TRE/2021/10).

The application states that tree failure is both likely and foreseeable due to the uncorrected lean of the main trunk and further crown displacement caused by the proximity of the adjacent oak trees. The application goes into detail of the mechanism of failure being the root-plate lifting, precipitated during a wet and windy weather event during which the soil could fail. However, the reliability and accuracy of this information is questionable. The application has not been supported by any diagnostic information from an appropriate expert. Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.  Therefore, if applicable, it is advisable to consult your tree surgeon / consultant to agree an acceptable time for carrying out the approved works.
